- nvim-lspconfig version(commit hash):
  - 0eccc1a
- What language server (If the problem is related to a specific language server):
  - I've only noticed this issue with pyright and sumenko_lua. I use typescript-language-server a lot and have never had this issue
- Can you reproduce this behavior on other language server clients (vscode, languageclient-neovim, coc.nvim, etc.):
  - have not been able to reproduce with vscode
- Can you reproduce this behavior on other language servers offered in the nvim-lspconfig repo? (pyls -> pyright):
  - no
- Is the problem isolated to a particular language server:
  - seems to just be just pyright and sumenko_lua
- Operating system/version:
  - arch linux/updated today

### How to reproduce the problem from neovim startup
1. install pyright, I installed from my distro's package manager `sudo pacman -S pyright`
2. download minimal init file from: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/master
3. add `'tpope/vim-surround'` to packer packages list (line 11 of minimal_init.lua)
2. `nvim -u minimal_init.lua test.py`
2. insert the text `f = {"foo"}`, using `<c-s>}` and `<c-s>"` to create matching pairs
3. leave insert mode and change the bracket spacing with `cs}{`

Note: this error comes up a lot in normal use, but this is the only reproducible way to generate it I've found

### Actual behaviour
The text that the lsp is processing seems become out of sync with the text actually in the buffer. Once out of sync various errors will be shown. Re-reading the file with `:e` always fixes the issue.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23488939/131427982-85d97216-6d20-4766-add6-92c662add7f8.mp4

### Expected behaviour
The errors from the lsp should match the text in nvim is showing me

### Minimal init.vim or init.lua and code sample
I'm using the minimal init as suggested: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/master/test/minimal_init.lua  with only one change, adding https://github.com/tpope/vim-surround/ because it makes this error easier to reproduce. I have seen this error without using this plugin, but using it is the most reliable way to reproduce.

comment_data.body: I can't reproduce with vim-surround, the text stays in sync with the buffer for me using your exact reproduction script.

I was trying to figure out what might be different about my system and noticed that the issue went away after restarting my computer, but the issue returns the next time neovim is opened. Seems to be true in a docker container as well.

I've made a [hopefully] reproducible docker image that demonstrates the issue. https://github.com/jay-aye-see-kay/nvim-sync-debug

I looked into this a bit tonight. It's the carriage return character (^M) that vim-surround inserts during the replacement. Easier repro (insert carriage return with c-v c-m)
```
a = 123
# add 1 by 1
a = ^M^M^M^M^M^M^M^M123 
# delete 1 by 1
a = 123
```
Is there an alternative to `vim-surround` that does not cause the breakage?
There's https://github.com/machakann/vim-sandwich. You could test and report here whether that has the same issue.
There's no reason surround.vim needs to use `\r` for this. I've changed it to another control character as a workaround.

Thanks @tpope! I didn't want to bother you with this since it's a neovim (and vim) quirk for representing buffer lines, it's just the complexity of us accounting for vim (and neovim) not splitting on \r is fairly high (and it affect coc.nvim too!). Thank you and sorry for any inconvenience! I've updated the issue title accordingly.

# Status 
From https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/16044#issuecomment-945006967 : 

> After talking to Bjorn, I'm realizing that the only real fix is:
> 
> > Internally split the buffers on carriage returns to normalize the neovim buffer state to that which the language server protocol expects (carriage return delineates newline) and keep an internal mapping of the true 8-bit clean buffer position to the LSP compatible buffer.

milestone.description: We don't plan to work on this, but will accept high quality contributions from someone who will own the feature and follow up on bug reports.
milestone.title: needs-owner

title: lsp: deleting inline carriage return (`\r`/`^M`) breaks incremental synchronization
